questions.text: Which Swedish pop group won Eurovision in 1974 with 'Waterloo'?
questions.explanation: ABBA launched their international career after winning Eurovision with 'Waterloo'.

questions.text: Which film's soundtrack is the best-selling disco album of all time?
questions.explanation: The 'Saturday Night Fever' soundtrack, featuring the Bee Gees, epitomized the disco era.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Piano Man'?
questions.explanation: Billy Joel released 'Piano Man' in 1973, which became his signature song.
Queen's operatic rock masterpiece was written by Freddie Mercury.

questions.text: Who sang 'I Will Survive', a disco anthem released in 1978?
questions.explanation: Gloria Gaynor's hit became a symbol of female empowerment and resilience.

questions.text: The Eagles' biggest hit 'Hotel California' was released in which year?
questions.explanation: The album and single 'Hotel California' were released in late 1976 (single early 1977).

questions.text: Which punk band released 'God Save the Queen' in 1977?
questions.explanation: The Sex Pistols released the controversial song during Queen Elizabeth II's Silver Jubilee.
'Rumours' is one of the best-selling albums ever, famous for the band's internal relationship dramas.

questions.text: David Bowie introduced which alter ego in 1972?
questions.explanation: Ziggy Stardust was Bowie's bisexual alien rock superstar persona.

questions.text: Which Bee Gees song is famously used for CPR training due to its tempo?
questions.explanation: 'Stayin' Alive' has a tempo of roughly 103 beats per minute, ideal for chest compressions.
John Lennon's 'Imagine', released in 1971, is his best-selling solo single.

questions.text: Which artist is known as the 'Queen of Disco'?
questions.explanation: Donna Summer had a string of disco hits including 'I Feel Love' and 'Last Dance'.

questions.text: Led Zeppelin's 'Stairway to Heaven' was released on which album?
questions.explanation: It appears on their untitled fourth album, commonly known as Led Zeppelin IV.

questions.text: Who recorded the concept album 'The Wall' released in 1979?
questions.explanation: Pink Floyd's rock opera 'The Wall' explores themes of isolation.

questions.text: Elton John's 'Candle in the Wind' was originally written about whom?
questions.explanation: The original 1973 version was a tribute to Marilyn Monroe. It was re-released in 1997 for Princess Diana.
